Transparency.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Transform Your Tomorrow - Cummins Supplier Portal
relevantSources.summary: Supply chain transparency framework emphasizing data collection for risk management.

relevantSources.title: 2023-2024 Cummins Sustainability Progress Report
relevantSources.summary: Sustainability report discussing transparency commitments and supply chain visibility.

relevantSources.summary: Framework for human rights-based AI transparency in public services.

relevantSources.title: Three Levels of AI Transparency - Lund University Research Portal
relevantSources.summary: Academic paper defining three levels of AI transparency implementation.

relevantSources.title: Transparency of AI Systems - Public now
relevantSources.summary: EU AI Act compliance whitepaper on transparency requirements.

Transparency.findings: Cummins provides detailed supply chain transparency frameworks and sustainability reports highlighting data collection and visibility practices. Additional sources offer frameworks and academic perspectives on AI transparency, including regulatory requirements, indicating a strong commitment to transparency in AI and related systems.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.summary: Comprehensive survey of fairness and bias sources, impacts, and mitigation strategies.

relevantSources.summary: Guidance brief on implementing fairness principles in AI development.

relevantSources.summary: Business-focused blog explaining AI bias mitigation strategies and approaches.

relevantSources.title: AI Bias Mitigation: Detecting and Reducing Bias in AI Models - Sapien
relevantSources.summary: Technical guide to detecting and reducing bias in AI models.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: The sources provide in-depth coverage of fairness and bias mitigation in AI, including surveys, practical guidelines, and technical guides. They describe specific methods for measuring, detecting, and reducing bias, indicating the availability of concrete evidence for this pillar.

Explainability.findings: The sources demonstrate concrete use of explainable AI at Cummins and provide frameworks, policy briefings, and technical guides on explainability and interpretability. This shows clear evidence of both practical application and awareness of explainability principles in AI systems.

summary.overallFindings: Cummins Inc. demonstrates comprehensive responsible AI practices across all seven pillars, with detailed, verifiable evidence in transparency, fairness, explainability, human oversight, privacy, governance, and public commitments. The company leverages both internal and external frameworks, academic research, and regulatory guidance to support its responsible AI approach. No significant gaps were identified, and the evidence base reflects a mature, well-documented responsible AI program.
